      Same as the 'actionPiece' method above except with special modifications to accommadate the functionality of ranged pieces which have separate move sets for moving and capturing.

      calls capturePiece() from Player class.
      java.lang.Boolean Board.checkRowForPawn(Player player, int col)
      Checks the specified row for a pawn belonging to the specified player.
      static void GUI.dropPiece(Player p, int piece, Move to)
      Drops the selected piece at the selected location on the board.
      java.lang.Boolean Board.dropPiece(Player player, int piece, Move pos)
      finds a matching piece to "piece" and adds it to the top of the tower with position "pos", if piece cannot be found in the player's hand then it doesn't do anything
      java.util.ArrayList<Move> Board.getDrops(Player p)
      Returns an array of moves that represent the available positions a piece can be dropped.
      java.util.ArrayList<Move> Board.getDrops(Player player, int piece)
      Returns an array of Moves of all possible spots a specific piece that the player selected can drop.
      void GUI.highlightDrops(Player p)
      Highlights all the possible spots a piece can drop in yellow
      void Board.playerInitializeDrop(Player p)
      Begins the initial dropping phase.
